means: 一种不稳定形式，部署或者秩序

sentence.Network_en: Truman allowed him to stagger on for nearly another two years.
sentence.Network_cn: 杜鲁门允许他又硬撑了近两年。

sentence.Network_en: Our management has decided to stagger our working hour.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的管理层已决定错开工作时间.

sentence.Network_en: The unexpected blow did not stagger his resolution.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个意外打击并没有动摇他的决心.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb): alteration of dialect stacker, from Old Norse stakra, frequentative of staka 'push, stagger'. The noun dates from the late 16th cent

entry.def: If you stagger, you walk very unsteadily, for example because you are ill or drunk.

example.ex: He lost his balance, staggered back against the rail and toppled over...
example.tran: 他失去平衡，往后趔趄了一下，撞到栏杆摔倒了。

example.ex: He was staggering and had to lean on the bar.
example.tran: 他走路摇摇晃晃，不得不靠在吧台上。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something staggers on, you mean that it is only just succeeds in continuing.

example.ex: Truman allowed him to stagger on for nearly another two years.
example.tran: 杜鲁门允许他又硬撑了近两年。

example.ex: ...a government that staggered from crisis to crisis.
example.tran: 在一次又一次危机中勉强维持的政府

entry.def: If something staggers you, it surprises you very much.

entry.tran: 使(假期或工作时间)错开
entry.def: To stagger things such as people's holidays or hours of work means to arrange them so that they do not all happen at the same time.

example.ex: During the past few years the government has staggered the summer vacation periods for students.
example.tran: 在过去几年里，政府将学生放暑假的时间相互错开。

means.word_mean: 1. walk as if unable to control one's movements;

sentences.sentence: "The drunken man staggered into the room"
"He staggered along in the heavy snow"

means.word_mean: 3. to arrange in a systematic order;

sentences.sentence: "stagger the chairs in the lecture hall"

means.word_mean: 4. astound or overwhelm, as with shock;

sentences.sentence: "She was staggered with bills after she tried to rebuild her house following the earthquake"

auth_sentence.content: A push made him stagger against the mizzen-mast.
auth_sentence.res_content: A push made him stagger against the mizzen-mast.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A push made him stagger against the mizzen-mast.

auth_sentence.content: So they stagger through until Monday, when they can finally get some rest.
auth_sentence.res_content: So they stagger through until Monday, when they can finally get some rest.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So they stagger through until Monday, when they can finally get some rest.

auth_sentence.content: This approach also made it much easier to stagger the introduction of new gameplay features without breaking level design.
auth_sentence.res_content: This approach also made it much easier to stagger the introduction of new gameplay features without breaking level design.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This approach also made it much easier to stagger the introduction of new gameplay features without breaking level design.

sentences.en: The difficulty of examination staggered him.
sentences.cn: 考试的难度使他很担心。

sentences.en: Our management has decided to stagger our working hour.
sentences.cn: 我们的管理层已决定错开工作时间。

jushi.english: He staggered to the door, bleeding from his wounds.
jushi.chinese: 他蹒跚地向大门走去,伤口流着血。

jushi.english: He staggered under a heavy burden.
jushi.chinese: 他被沉重的担子压得摇摇晃晃。

jushi.english: The drunken man staggered towards me.
jushi.chinese: 那个醉汉摇摇晃晃地向我走来。
